ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:0.2_0: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:0.5_0: 57. The training rule on not inviting
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.2_0: On one occasion a number of nuns who had completed the rainy-season residence in a village monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.4_0: “Venerables, where did you spend the rains residence?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.5_0: Where did you invite the Sangha of monks for correction?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.6_0: “We didn’t invite the Sangha of monks for correction.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.7_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.8_0: “How can nuns who have completed the rains residence not invite the Sangha of monks for correction?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that nuns didn’t do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.12_0: “... How could nuns not do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.14_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.15.1_0: ‘If a nun who has completed the rainy-season residence does not invite correction from both Sanghas in regard to three things—what has been seen, what has been heard, and what has been suspected—she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.1.6_0: not having stayed for the first three or the last three months of the rainy season.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.1.7_0: If she thinks, “I won’t invite correction from both Sanghas in regard to three things—what has been seen, heard, or suspected,” then by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.2.3_0: if she searches, but is unable to find anyone to relinquish it to;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.2.5_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.2.7_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.2.8_0: The seventh rule, the training rule on married girls, is finished.
